Steps.StepString: Started with network scan using Nmap

Substeps.SubstepString: Initiated a network scan using Nmap

Steps.StepString: Identified that the Apache server version 2.4.49 is operating on port 12380

Substeps.SubstepString: Performed a port scan and identified Apache server version 2.4.49 operating on port 12380

Steps.StepString: Determined that this version of Apache had a known vulnerability

Substeps.SubstepString: Conducted research and determined that Apache server version 2.4.49 has a known vulnerability

Steps.StepString: Checked the related details on a popular vulnerability database, https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/50383

Substeps.SubstepString: Visited the vulnerability database at https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/50383

Steps.StepString: Leveraged the above-mentioned Remote Code Execution (RCE) vulnerability aiming to gain access to the system

Substeps.SubstepString: Exploited the Remote Code Execution (RCE) vulnerability to gain unauthorized access to the system

Steps.StepString: Composed a malicious HTTP GET request to exploit the vulnerability

Substeps.SubstepString: Crafted a malicious HTTP GET request to exploit the identified vulnerability

Steps.StepString: Provided a series of directory traversal characters in the request (/%2e%2e/%2e%2e) aimed at accessing server roots

Substeps.SubstepString: Inserted a series of directory traversal characters (/%2e%2e/%2e%2e) in the request to access server root directories

Steps.StepString: Used the above to execute commands to retrieve the contents of the flagged file located at /secret/safe/flag.png

Substeps.SubstepString: Exploited the directory traversal vulnerability to execute commands and retrieve the contents of the flagged file located at /secret/safe/flag.png

Steps.StepString: Converted the file content to base64 to ensure that the PNG file content is transferred without any encoding issues

Substeps.SubstepString: Encoded the contents of the retrieved file in base64 format for smooth transfer without encoding issues
